ul.li: Login to the TMS system using your corporate userId

context.p: One important point to note is that both Automated and Manual test cases need to be created in TMS.
A fundamental point in the ISTQB syllabus is that an automated test should be documented in the exact same manner as a manual test case.

step.cmd: From the Quick Links section select “Create a Test Case”

info.p: Click on the "Create a Test Case" in order to go to the test case form.

step.p: There are a number of mandatory parameters:

ol.li: Type: Type of test case. Functional, Robustness etc.
Product: Product the test case is verifying
Feature: Feature the test case is verifying
Component: Component the test case is verifying
Requirement Id: either a valid Jira Epic or User Story Id. If the requirement does not exist then the test case can’t be created

A Unique Test Case Id: This is an Id that will follow the test case through test execution and reporting. The Id should reflect the epic, user story or feature you are testing. It is a key enabler for automatic trace-ability.

step.cmd: Fill out the remaining fields as appropriate

sl.sli: Group: KGB, CDB, RFA, GAT etc.
Context: UI, CLI, REST or API test case
Execution Type: Manual or Automated test case
Status: Preliminary, In Review or Approved state
Test Steps: Action and Verify tests
Test Data: Data relevant to test step
Files: This is a utility to store files for a test case. The supported file types are "txt", "csv", "py", "sh", "bash", "pyw", "pyo", "pyc", "pyd", "log", "zip", "gzip", "png", "jpg", "gz".

step.cmd: When all fields are complete, select “Save”
step.p: Now the test case has been created. See Results below.

result.p: Your test case had been added to TMS
